Question: What year did Walt Disney World officially open?
AnswerBonus: Roy O. Disney dedicated the Magic Kingdom on October 1, 1971.

Question: At Disneyland, what is the name of the small apartment above the Fire Station on Main Street, U.S.A.?
AnswerBonus: The lamp remains lit as a tribute to Walt Disney’s spirit in the park.

Question: Which Disney park was the first to open outside the United States?
AnswerBonus: Tokyo Disneyland opened in 1983.

Question: How tall is Cinderella Castle at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World?
AnswerBonus: Though its water-level height is 183 ft, from moat to spire it totals 189 ft. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

Question: What is the name of the hidden underground tunnel system beneath Magic Kingdom called?
AnswerBonus: Because the park is built “on the second floor,” cast members use these tunnels to stay out of guest sight. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

Question: Which ride is the only attraction found in every Disney theme park worldwide (as of 2025)?
AnswerBonus: Dumbo can be found in all six Disney resort theme-park systems globally. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

Question: The Tree of Life, the iconic centerpiece of Disney’s Animal Kingdom, features how many carved animal images on its trunk and roots?
AnswerBonus: There are 337 carvings of real and extinct animals in the Tree of Life. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

Question: Which Disney park’s signature nighttime show projects onto Cinderella Castle using projection-mapping technology?
AnswerBonus: Shows like "Happily Ever After" and "Enchantment" use the castle as a projection canvas.

Question: In the Liberty Square area of Magic Kingdom, how many lanterns hang from the Liberty Tree, representing the original colonies?
AnswerBonus: They represent the 13 original American colonies. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

Question: Which Disneyland-era monorail is the first daily operating monorail in the Western Hemisphere, and what year did it begin service?
AnswerBonus: Disneyland’s monorail began daily service June 14, 1959. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

Question: What was Disneyland’s original land before Tomorrowland was constructed?
AnswerBonus: Frontierland was part of the original Disneyland layout; Tomorrowland was added later in 1955 expansions.

Question: What was the first attraction of the Disney World park to welcome guests (i.e. first to open)?
Answer: Walt Disney World Railroad / Main Street Vehicles
AnswerBonus: The railroad and Main Street vehicles were operational on opening day, October 1, 1971.

Question: What is the oldest operating attraction in Magic Kingdom at Walt Disney World?
AnswerBonus: It is the oldest continually operating ride at Magic Kingdom. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

Question: Which former ride’s ride vehicles and track were reused to build the Frozen Ever After attraction at Epcot?
AnswerBonus: Many ride elements from Maelstrom were repurposed for Frozen Ever After. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

Question: Disneyland’s Haunted Mansion in California has a different feature than its counterpart in Florida. What is unique about the stretching room at Disneyland?
Answer: It is an actual elevator that descends
AnswerBonus: Disneyland’s stretching room physically moves downward for effect, unlike Magic Kingdom’s illusion method. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

Question: Which Disneyland castle is 77 ft tall but made to appear larger through forced perspective?
AnswerBonus: The castle uses lighter colors and narrowing architectural scale to create a grander illusion. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

Question: How many leaves are on the Tree of Life at Disney’s Animal Kingdom?
AnswerBonus: The tree features about 102,000 artificial leaves. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

Question: Which pavilion in Epcot’s World Showcase features Guy Fieri’s recipes, soda floats, and experimental foods?
AnswerBonus: No World Showcase pavilion features Guy Fieri’s menu — this is sometimes joked about on social media. (If you want a serious question, I can swap it.)

Question: Which Disney water park opened on June 1, 1989, and features Mount Mayday and the “Miss Tilly” shrimp boat?
AnswerBonus: ‘Miss Tilly’ erupts a 50-ft geyser every half hour. :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}

Question: What was the original name of the project that became Disney’s Animal Kingdom prior to its public announcement?
Answer: The Disney’s Wild Kingdom (or Project Wild)
AnswerBonus: The working term “Project Wild” was used during its early planning phases (common trivia lore).

Question: Which Disneyland attraction served as the inspiration for the design of the Disneyland Paris version of Space Mountain?
AnswerBonus: Paris’ version adopted a more spiral-ready shell design influenced by its predecessors.

Question: How many steam locomotives power the Walt Disney World Railroad, and how old are they roughly (built between which years)?
AnswerBonus: All four are over 100 years old. :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

Question: Which Magic Kingdom land is designed to be historically accurate so that it contains no restrooms within its boundaries (they are instead placed beyond its threshold)?
AnswerBonus: Restrooms are cleverly situated in adjacent lands to preserve theme integrity. :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}

Question: Which Disney park in Florida is the smallest by acreage?
AnswerBonus: Magic Kingdom is the smallest of the four Walt Disney World parks by land size. :contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}

Question: What is the name of the signature nighttime show at Epcot that features fireworks, fountains, and projection effects?
Answer: Harmonious (or its current replacement depending on timeline)
AnswerBonus: Harmonious was one of the major nighttime spectaculars tied to EPCOT’s 35th anniversary.

Question: Which Disneyland ride was one of Walt Disney’s first ideas after witnessing his daughters ride a merry-go-round at Griffith Park?
Answer: Disneyland (the park) / the idea of a family park (not a particular ride)

Question: How many original Disney theme parks are there globally (counting Tokyo, Paris, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Disneyland (CA), and Disney World)?
AnswerBonus: These include Disneyland (CA), Magic Kingdom (FL), Tokyo, Paris, Hong Kong, and Shanghai.

Question: Which Disneyland attraction was originally built for the 1964–65 New York World’s Fair before being relocated?

Question: Which Disneyland ride’s façade is designed to look like a fairytale castle but is only 77 feet tall?

Question: When was the first daily operating Disneyland monorail inaugurated?
AnswerBonus: It was the first daily operating monorail in the Western Hemisphere. :contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}
